description: Sallow Sedge (Carex lurida) is a unique and amazing plant species. It's light tan inflorescences along the tall stems contrast nicely with the bright green leaves, creating an eye-catching combination. It prefers wet habitats and can be found growing in marshes, moist woods, and along streams. It also has a long flowering period stretching from the early part of the summer to late fall, creating stunning visuals all season long. What's more, it's a very hardy plant and has a long lifespan, making it a great choice for a long-term garden feature. Whether planted in large groups for dramatic impact or included as a detail in a meadow, Sallow Sedge is a beautiful and versatile plant.
